fields.description:
Hi team,

Confluence Cloud currently can not handle multiple apps with the same macro name. If a conflict exists, the app that was installed first is the one that is displayed in the macro editor, the other is disabled.

An example of this is the Button macro in [Content Formatting for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/247/content-formatting-macros-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] and the Button macro in [MacroSuite for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222649/macrosuite-easy-html-button-hide-content-divider-tabs?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]. 

As the cloud marketplace matures further, there are likely going to be more clashes between apps (especially for common element names like buttons).This isn't a great experience for our customers. 

This bug was closed previously but we believe should be considered given the current requirements of migrating to Cloud ->  CONFCLOUD-58419

All the best,

Dylan
fields.summary: Duplicate Macro Names Disabling One Feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The 'onclick' event listener is missing for 'Select All' button under app permissions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to space settings - permissions - app permissions
 # Edit permissions
 # Click on select all button 

h3. Expected Results

It should select all the permissions in one click 
h3. Actual Results

nothing happens
h3. Workaround

manually select all the permissions individually
fields.summary: The 'onclick' event listener is missing for 'Select All' button under app permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using Confluence on Ubuntu with Chrome. When we edit a page and leave the editor open we notice that the page crashes overnight. It takes around 20h+

Page crashes and shows 'Aw Snap'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # login to you Confluence site on Ubuntu through Chrome web browser.
 # create a new page. Add some text and publish it.
 # Go to edit the page again and add some text
 # leave the page without publishing.
 # check back after 20+ hours. Eventually you will see the page crash with 'Aw Snap'

Chrome: 95.0.4638.69 64bit

Ubuntu: 20.04.03 LTS
h3. Expected Results

The page should not crash.
h3. Actual Results

Page crash with 'Aw Snap'

The below exception is thrown in the chrome_debug.log file:
{noformat}
ERROR:broker_posix.cc(46)] Received unexpected number of handles {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page works and the edits come back.
fields.summary: Leaving Editor open overnight causes 'Aw Snap' on Chrome running on Ubuntu

fields.description:
This relates to 
 # CONFCLOUD-52532

While the bug is "closed" a believe some of the commenters are actually looking for the EPIC LINK NAME to be a displayable field.  For me this would be a nice feature.
fields.summary: Add Epin LINK name

fields.description:
Adding In-Line Comments while Page is in Draft counts as a page change.

After Publish the Page, go to Page History and there will be a new Page version created, however if you compare the current and the last version, a Blank Page is showed.

It was expected to show at least the changes related to the comments add/resolved.
fields.summary: Adding In-Line Comments while Page is in Draft counts as a page change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unwatching a page you created does not prevent in-app notifications in confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page & unwatch it
* Have someone make an edit to that page

h3. Expected Results
You will not receive any in-app notification about the changes.

h3. Actual Results
You will still receive an in-app (push) notification even though you’ve unwatched the page.


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unwatching a page you created does not prevent in-app notifications in confluence cloud

fields.description:
h4. Problem
There's no way to see which spaces are accessible by anonymous users, apart from a SQL query or by visiting the site anonymously.

h4. Suggestion
Provide a way for users or admins to get a list of these spaces within the UI, for example, by adding a filter to the Space Directory.
fields.summary: Ability to filter public (anonymous) spaces in All Spaces list

https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/L10N-1623

fields.description: Since it seems deleted comments cannot be restored, it would be helpful if they could appear in the admin audit log, and possibly send an email notification to the author and Space Admins so the information can be reviewed/stored accordingly.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users browse to Confluence using {*}Safari{*}, users receive this "We've hit a snag [...] The code associated with this error: <ERROR CODE>" message
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Safari
 # Try to access any Confluence Cloud page

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to access and view the Confluence page successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The user receives an error message:
{noformat}
We've hit a snagThe issue should resolve on its own, but if it keeps happening, ask your admin to contact our support team and give them:
The URL of this page
The code associated with this error: <ERROR CODE> {noformat}
 - The error code can be:
 -- r6r9ki
 -- 7qp240
 -- rg9jvm

!Screen Shot 2021-11-10 at 17.55.27.png|width=320,height=95!
h3. Workaround

It seems to be happening only on Safari versions previous than 15 (the latest stable version).
Using Chrome and Firefox seems to be working fine.
Updating Safari to *15.0* also seems to resolve the issue.
fields.summary: When users browse to Confluence using Safari, users receive this "We've hit a snag [...] The code associated with this error: <ERROR CODE>" message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Keyboard shortcut \(!\) does not render to warning symbol in editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Type \(!\) in editor
 !image-2021-11-10-09-55-17-212.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Should render to warning symbol as per https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-symbols-emojis-and-special-characters/

h3. Actual Results
Does not render

h3. Workaround
Use :warning: instead
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut (!) does not render warning symbol in editor

fields.description:
h3. Description

When adding/editing the _Excerpt Include_ macro with the "Remove Surrounding Panel" option cleared (i.e., +not+ ticked), the name of the source page appears in *bold* text at the top of a panel box surrounding the excerpted contents.

As for many other page-referencing macros, it would be convenient if the page name were an hyperlink (as an option).
h3. Suggestion

Include an additional option in the _Excerpt Include_ macro add/edit popup to make the page name displayed in the surrounding panel rendered as an hyperlink. This tick box could be grayed out whenever the "Remove Surrounding Panel" option is ticked.
fields.summary: Make the page name displayed in the Surrounding Panel of the Excerpt Include macro optionnaly clickable

fields.description:
At the moment, when clicking on the site logo in Confluence, users will be redirected to the site homepage set up by the admin.

This feature would allow users to customize the URL for the logo.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the URL link in the site logo

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we add a JIRA Issue/Filter macro, it says at the bottom:
{quote}Hint: type "Cmd+Shift+J" in the editor to quickly access this dialog.{quote}
OR
{quote}Hint: type "Ctrl+Shift+J" in the editor to quickly access this dialog.{quote}
But this doesn't work for Chrome on Mac OS or Windows.
 !image-2021-11-08-22-04-42-407.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using Chrome, create a page or edit an existing one
 # Try to use the "Cmd+Shift+J" or "Ctrl+Shift+J" shortcuts to open the Jira macro.

h3. Expected Results
It should add a Jira macro to the page.

h3. Actual Results
On Mac OS, it opens the browser's downloads and on Windows it opens the browser's developer console.

h3. Workaround
Type "/" and then search for "Jira" to insert the macro.
fields.summary: Keyboard to add a Jira Issue/ Filter macro doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* In the Confluence editor, if we were to paste any invalid whitespaces like "0x8", the character is automatically removed to allow the page to be published.
* But if this character is in the "Status macro", it is not removed, and the page cannot be published.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the site below, and paste "0001000", binary for 0x8, and convert it to ASCII/UTF-8.
** https://www.rapidtables.com/convert/number/binary-to-ascii.html
# Copy the result, and try pasting it into a page in Confluence and publish the page.
** The content is removed automatically and the page is published.
# Try adding the same content into a "Status macro", and try publishing the page.
# You'll hit into the error below.
** {code}
Your work is safe, but there’s an issue
Error converting ADF to storage format{code}
# This issue might be affecting other macros as well.

h3. Expected Results
* The invalid content is removed automatically and the page should be publishable.

h3. Actual Results
* The invalid content is not removed, and the page cannot be published.
* The below exception is seen in our logs.
** {noformat}
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Invalid white space character (0x8) in text to output
com.ctc.wstx.sw.XmlWriter.throwInvalidChar(XmlWriter.java:545)
com.ctc.wstx.sw.BufferingXmlWriter.writeCharacters(BufferingXmlWriter.java:453)
com.ctc.wstx.sw.BaseStreamWriter.writeCharacters(BaseStreamWriter.java:518)
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
* Manually search for and remove the problematic content.
fields.summary: Whitespace is not removed from Status macro like it is removed from the page's content

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if we add a Jira macro based on a JQL filter, the macro will load the latest results from that filter every time we access the page.

This might be a problem for cases when we have a meeting notes page, for example, were we need the Jira data to be static to that specific moment, for future reference.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to have a way to set the macro as static, instead of dynamically generating the results every time the page is accessed. 

h3. Workaround
Taking a screenshot from Jira is a workaround but this way we won't have the link to the ticket available.

Another workaround would be to link the Jira tickets individually, this way the list won't change but the ticket's status and other fields will still change.
fields.summary: Static Jira macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a Jira Issue that uses the *specific time/date* option. Then input that into a Team Calendar, the Issue Date range won't appear.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Created new Jira Project
 # Set up Applink to connect Confluence to Jira
 # Create Jira Issue
 # On the Jira Issue add two custom fields for *time stamp* where I set the below dates:
 ** Custom Start 11/30/2021 @ 12PM
 ** Custom End 12/1/2021 @ 12PM
 # Navigate to the Calendar
 # Add event and choose *Jira Issue Date*
 # Select project with the issue
 

h3. Expected Results

It should contain a date range when viewing the card on Team Calendar similar to the below screenshot:

!Screen Shot 2021-11-08 at 12.09.54 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The Team Calendar event card does not provide a date similar to the below screenshot:

!Screen Shot 2021-11-08 at 12.10.10 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently no known workaround
fields.summary: Jira Issue Date event won't show date/time range on Team Calendar

fields.description:
The native export function does not provide us with the options we need for our output, so we exclusively use Scroll PDF Exporter. 

However, the Scroll PDF Exporter is way down in the More menu and the first one is the native Confluence Export, so a lot of our people are not looking any further, use this function and then complain that the output is not what they expected.

It would really be good to be able to deactivate it, like it used to be in the server version.
fields.summary: Option to deactivate Confluence Export function

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
In the new "Configuration experience" for Macros, the option to save the configuration options is not clear to every user.

This leads to user thinking that the options have been saved while they are not.

For apps with required fields, upon publishing the page, the macro will show the "Edit to setup" message.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a macro with one required parameter
# Configure that parameter
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The macro shows its expected content.

h3. Actual Results
The macro shows the "Edit to setup" message which implies a mandatory parameter is missing.

h3. Suggested solution
Improve the user experience around saving the configuration options.

h3. Workaround
The configuration options are saved when the field loses is focus. This can be done by clicking on another field or the {{X}} in the _macro configuration panel_  which appears as a panel on the right side of a page.
Clicking on the page itself (including the "Publish" button) will not save the macro configuration.
fields.summary: Saving the macro configuration options is not as intuitive as it could be

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Links to images and image comments are not working.
[Problem demo video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/412970/Screen%20Recording%202021-11-06%20at%207.27.25%20PM.mov]:  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the new editor.
 # Upload images to this page.
 # Add attachment macro to this page and publish it(this is a workaround due to another bug CONFCLOUD-73067).
 # While on the published mode, open the image from the attachment macro by clicking on "*view*" and [pin down some comments|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-and-comment-on-files/] on the image.
 # Place the Gallery macro on this page and publish it.
 # Preview one of the images(gallary macro) by clicking on it and copy the preview URL/link from the browser's address bar.
 # Create another page, add some words. Highlight a word and paste the link from the clipboard. This should add the preview link of the image.
 # Similarly, get the link for one of the pinned image comments by clicking the pin(preview mode) and copying the URL from the address bar on the gallery macro page. Hyperlink a word on the second page.

h3. Expected Results
After clicking the hyperlinked word on the second page, it should redirect to the gallery macro page showing the image in preview mode or the pinned comment(preview mode) depending on which hyperlink was clicked.

h3. Actual Results
After clicking the hyperlinked word on the second page, it just redirects to the gallery macro page(does not show the image in preview mode).


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Image preview is not shown when linking from another page
Updating pages via REST API using the "view" representation does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When [public links|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-content-externally-with-public-links] are enabled at the global level, if any user who does not have write access on the page tried to share the page through public links, gets a warning message showing
{code:java}
"Some people won’t be able to view this page unless you enable the public link."{code}
 

However, the user is not able to enable public links because the user does not have written access to the page and the toggle is not displayed:
h3. !image-2021-11-05-10-44-09-634.png|width=413,height=401!
h3. Suggestion

Since this is happening because the user does not have write access to the page, a correct more informed message should be displayed.

Instead of not having the option to toggle the public link, it should say a message like "User does not have write permission on the page to enable public links".
fields.summary: Improve public link message for users without write permission on the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The heading IDs returned by the [Get content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-get] REST API endpoint are different than the ones rendered in Confluence UI.

This is not an issue on pages using the legacy editor (it only seems to happen in the new editor).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a heading (e.g. page title "new page", with a heading 2 text saying "Heading Two")
 # Click on the icon to copy the link to heading and paste it somewhere
 # Open the developer console and find the Heading ID
!Test-Heading-2.jpg|thumbnail!
 # Call the [Get content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-get] REST API endpoint and find the Heading ID in there too:
{noformat}https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/<page-id>?expand=body.view{noformat}
# Compare the Heading IDs collected in steps 2, 3 and 4

 
h3. Expected Results

The IDs are the same
h3. Actual Results

The IDs are different ("Heading-Two" in UI and link copied, "HeadingTwo" in the REST API response body):


*Heading link copied:*
{code:java}
https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/{KEY}/pages/{ID}/New+Page#Heading-Two 
{code}
*UI (Dev Console):*
{noformat}
<h2 id="Heading-Two" ... >{noformat}
*Rest API:*
{noformat}
<h2 id=\"NewPage-HeadingTwo\">{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: The Heading IDs returned via REST API are different than the ones rendered in the UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Confluence Server and Data Center, we have a third-party add-on called [Vertical Align for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222494/vertical-align-for-confluence?tab=overview&hosting=server], developed and supported by [Web Development Laboratory|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/1218188/web-development-laboratory], that created the ability to align content vertically in our pages. There is no such third-party add-on for Confluence Cloud, though.

h3. Suggestion
* Add the ability to vertically align content as a default functionality on Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Vertical alignment

fields.description:
IP Allowlisting is a useful tool for allowing an organization to share Confluence pages such as newsletters, blogs, and documentation with users that only need read-only access so long as they are on-site, sharing a specific IP address.

Currently though it is an all or nothing proposition and the benefits of on-site sharing have to be weighed against remote contributors being able to access the site at all.

 

I would like to be able to protect "public" pages from unauthorized access by using IP Allowlisting for any user that does not have a Confluence license. For those that do have a license, I would like them to be able to access the site from any IP when properly authenticated.

 

An alternate way to solve this scenario would be to create a "read-only" user tier. This would be similar to what products like Salesforce offer. Read-only users would not be able to contribute to document creation aside from commenting, but would have access to view any pages that are configured for that group.
fields.summary: Allow licensed users to bypass IP Allowlisting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For old/legacy editor pages, export of space/page to PDF fails when content by label macro is used inside section macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Create an *old/legacy editor page* using a legacy editor template.
 # Step 2: Insert the "*Section*" macro into the page.
 # Step 3: Insert a "*Content by Label*" macro inside the "*Section*" macro by adding some labels.
 # Step 4: *Save* and *Publish* the Page.
 # Step 5: Try to *export the page* or the whole space into PDF format.

h3. Expected Results

PDF should be ready to download like below:
 !image-2021-11-04-16-56-53-445.png!
h3. Actual Results

The PDF export fails with an error "*We couldn't complete your export. Exception thrown while rendering the page 'null' to the PDF document /data/confluence/home/temp/XXXXXXXXX*" like below:
 !image-2021-11-04-16-59-19-970.png!

The below exception is thrown in the Splunk logs:
{code:java}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException:{code}
Logger:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportTaskRunnerImpl{code}
h3. Workaround

At the moment, remove the "*Section*" macro and use only the "*Content by Label*" macro in the old/legacy editor.
fields.summary: Export of space/page to PDF fails when content by label macro used inside section macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a page with brackets ([  ]) on its title will cause problems when trying to access it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page called *[TEST] Page*
 # Copy its link and try to access it

h3. Expected Results
The page should load just fine

h3. Actual Results
The browser will throw an "ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS" error and after a minute or so, another error page will be shown:
 {quote}You're almost there
It looks like our database is taking a little longer than usual to sync up. Wait a few moments then try again.
If you continue to see this error, raise a support request{quote}
| !browser.png|thumbnail! |
| !confluence.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Removing everything after the page ID in the URL will work.
For example, if the page URL is {color:#DE350B}instance_name.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACE/pages/12345/[TEST]+Page{color}, accessing {color:#00875A}instance_name.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACE/pages/12345{color} will work without problems.
fields.summary: Accessing a page with brackets in the title might cause too many redirect errors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Even though Spaces in Confluence are linked to a knowledge base project in JSM and the permissions are set to Restricted in JSM (which allows unlicensed users in Confluence), every time Unlicensed Users tries to access a page link in Confluence (unlicensed user permission on the space), it redirects them to a " user xxx@email.com doesn't have access to Confluence" or "The admin denied your request".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Atlassian Account test
 # Go to the *admin.atlassian.com* with a site-admin account and grant only Has site access to the test account
 # Create a Space in Confluence
 # Create a project in JSM and link the knowledge base with the space in Confluence
 # Set the viewing permissions in the knowledge base to *Restricted*
 # Copy a page link for the Confluence Space that is open to unlicensed users
 # On an Incognito window, login with the test account at id.atlassian.com
 # Paste the link for the page in Confluence

h3. Expected Results

If the space is open to Unlicensed users, it should allow the authenticated Unlicensed User to see the page in that space linked with the knowledge base in JSM.
h3. Actual Results

It says the user doesn't have access to Confluence or similar messages.
h3. Workaround

After getting the error on the first try, pasting the URL link again, works on the second try.
fields.summary: Unlicensed Users receive doesn't have access to Confluence message even if the space is open to unlicensed users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying a page with restrictions using the [Copy single page (POST /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/copy) REST API endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-copy-post] fails (returning status code 500 - Internal Server Error) when specifying a target page to overwrite and copying the restrictions. 

Everything seems to be working fine if you either copy to a new page or you don't copy the page restrictions.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with restrictions
 # Use the [Copy page REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-copy-post] endpoint to create a new copy of the page (specifying the parent). See that this works fine:
{noformat}
curl -u <EMAIL-ADDRESS>:<API-TOKEN> -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '\{"destination":{"type":"parent_page","value":"{parent_id}"}, "copyPermissions":"true", "pageTitle":"copy name"}' 'https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/copy'
{noformat}

 # Edit the page
 # Copy the page again using the same REST API endpoint, but now try to replace an existing page (e.g. the copy we just created in step #2):
{noformat}
curl -u <EMAIL-ADDRESS>:<API-TOKEN> {{-X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '\{"destination":{"type":"existing_page","value":"{copy_id}"}, "copyPermissions":"true", "pageTitle":"copy name"}' }}{{'https://NAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/copy'
{noformat}
 
  

h3. Expected Results

The destination page is successfully overwritten with a copy of the source page
h3. Actual Results

{"statusCode":500,"message":"java.lang.NullPointerException: null"}

 

The below exception is thrown in the logs:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying/pasting a macro inside a bodied macro, it causes the text outside the bodied macro to be pushed in (screenshot attached).

On my internal instance, it only happened when pasting with right click -> paste (not happening with cmd+v).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and add a bodied macro;
 # Add some text outside (below) that macro
 # Create another macro within the one added on the prev step
 # Copy and paste (with mouse right click -> paste) macro created on step 3
 # Text will jump into the macro

h3. Expected Results

Macro is pasted without interfering with any other text
h3. Actual Results

Text from outside the macro is pushed in.
h3. Workaround

Use Cmd+v instead
fields.summary: Copying nested bodied macros in the new fabric editor results text outside the macro being pushed to inside it

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Scheduling blog posts set wrong publish date
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a draft blog post
 # Schedule the publish for the next day or another date in the future 
 # Meanwhile, add a blog post macro on the overview page or any other page in the same space to display all the blogs
 # Let the blog be published on the scheduled date and time.
 # The blog creation date is the date when the publish was scheduled.

h3. Expected Results

The blog post macro should also show the same creation date as the blog. 
h3. Actual Results

In the blog post macro, the problem is that the blog post has the published date when it was created. as a draft.

Attached screen recording for reference.

https://www.loom.com/share/307b1e48653348e7846e2f601750d7b8
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scheduling blog posts sets wrong publish date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The PDF export of a Confluence page having 'Create from Template' macro is failing with an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a Confluence page containing the 'Create from Template' macro.
 # Take a PDF export.  The export fails with an error.

h3. Expected Results

The PDF export of a Confluence page with the 'Create from Template' macro should show up without any errors.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the PDF file
{noformat}
.Error rendering macro 'create-from-template' : Failed to find net.sf.hibernate.Session from the current thread
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Take the export of the page in Word and convert it to PDF.
fields.summary: The PDF export of a Confluence page having 'Create from Template' macro is failing with an error.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

PDF export of Confluence page with Page properties report macro is not responsive as per the content size.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page with Page properties report macro. The macro should contain 4-5 columns. Also, the columns should have large data.
 # Take the pdf export of this page. The pdf content may get misaligned if the content is large.

h3. Expected Results

The pdf export of the Page properties report macro should be responsive to the content.
h3. Actual Results

The pdf export of the Page properties report may get misaligned if there is higher content.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. However, taking the export of the page in Word and converting it to PDF may work in specific cases.
fields.summary: PDF export of a Confluence page with Page properties report macro is not responsive to the content size.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a Team Calendar event. Then click on the event. The day displayed on the card will be 1 day behind the actual Calendar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Team Calendar
 # Create an Event for a future date
 # Save the event
 # Click on the newly created event on the calendar
 # Notice the day listed on the display card is one day behind the calendar

h3. Expected Results

The display card date should match the calendar dates for the event.
h3. Actual Results

The display card shows the previous day dates. Notice in the below screenshot. That the Event is on the 9th but the display card shows the 8th.
 !Screen Shot 2021-11-02 at 5.06.46 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Edit the event and uncheck the *All Day* box. Then enter a time/date window to reflect the correct time and date.
fields.summary: Team Calendar Event date and display card date don't match

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 

When instances have deprecated apps installed, if users try to create spaces, the following error message is displayed and the creation modal keeps spinning:
{code:java}
We can't create that blueprint right now.  {code}
From the browser's console, the following error is displayed:
{code:java}
{"errorCode":500,"errorType":"UNKNOWN","errorMessage":"Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only"}{code}
h3. Suggestion

Although the space gets created, no home page is configured nor there is a confirmation that it has worked.

In the end, this issue is caused by deprecated apps installed in which cannot have their users added to existing space permissions. Specifically:
 * Any.do for Confluence
 * Atlassian Cards for Confluence.
 * Confluence Property Tool
 * Confluence universal importer

This is a suggestion to improve the error message to confirm that certain apps must be uninstalled in order to be able to create spaces. For example:
{quote}
You have deprecated apps that are impacting the space's creation. To be able to create a space, make sure to uninstall the following apps:

* Any.do for Confluence
* Atlassian Cards for Confluence.
* Confluence Property Tool
* Confluence universal importer
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve error handling when deprecated apps impact the creation of spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon trying to [copy or move a page to a specific parent|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/], if there are multiple pages with the same word in their title, when using the "search" option for the *Parent page* part, some of these pages will not be displayed even when an exact search match is used.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have a couple of pages (around 20) with similar titles (I.E. "Test page", "Test a new page", "Test words", "Test").
 # On a different page, tap the ellipsis button at the top-right and select the *Move* or *Copy* options.
 ## If selecting *Move*, tap the *Search* option instead of *Browse pages*
 # Under the *Parent page* of the *Search* dialog, type the title of the page to be searched. For example, the "Test" page which has only a single word in the title.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be displayed on the search results.
h3. Actual Results

The page is not displayed in the search results, making it impossible to copy or move pages to it, even when using quotes.
h3. Workaround
 # Create the copies by using a different parent and then, with the *Move* option, use the *Browse pages* function to find the page in question in the sidebar.
 # Use the workaround of CONFCLOUD-73112 (access the page that should be the parent, publish it and search again).
fields.summary: Unable to find certain pages with the "search" option when moving or copying pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When working to [move pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/], the "move" dialog will have the *Browse pages* option which allows pages to be searched as they are displayed in the sidebar/page tree.

However, this option is not available in the "copy" dialog, relying only on the manual search. In situations where there are too many pages with similar words on their titles, some pages will not be found since it that display a limited number of results.
h3. Suggestion

This is a suggestion to add the *Browse pages* option to the "copy" dialog as well. This way, the users can manually search for the pages as well, avoiding any limitations to have the results displayed!
fields.summary: Add the "Browse pages" function to the copy dialog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon trying to [copy or move a page to a specific parent|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/], pages that were recently accessed are not displayed on the "Recent pages" part of the "search" option for the *Parent page* part.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a page in Confluence.
 # On a different page, tap the ellipsis button at the top-right and select either *Move* or *Copy*.
 # If selecting *Move* tap the *Search* option and then, tap the page displayed in the *Parent page* dialog so it will open a list of *Recent pages*. For the *Copy* option, once the dialog to copy the page is open, simply tap the page under the *Parent page* dialog.

h3. Expected Results

As in the Confluence home page, the page should be displayed on the list of recently accessed pages.
h3. Actual Results

The page is not displayed. It is necessary to manually search for it.
h3. Workaround

There are two workarounds for this scenario:
 * Publish the recently viewed page and refresh the page to be moved/copied so the dialog can be used again.
 * Manually search for the page if there is not a high number of pages in the space with a similar title. Otherwise, the page might not be displayed on the search.
fields.summary: "Recent pages" on the search for the Move/Copy dialog does not retrieve the recently viewed pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Previously when we click on an image in the Gallery macro, the URL in the address bar is updated to that specific image.
** This allows users to copy the URL and share it with someone else.
* Now, the URL is not updated, and just shows the URL of the page, causing the image to no longer be sharable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page, either in the legacy editor, or the new editor.
** To make the images in the gallery macro clickable, use the workaround in [CONFCLOUD-73067|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-73067].
# Add some images to the page and add in the Gallery macro.
# Publish the page, and click on the image in the macro.
# Check on the URL in the address bar.
# The URL will just be the URL of the page itself, and not the URL to the specific image in the gallery macro.

h3. Expected Results
* When an image is clicked in the gallery macro, the URL in the address bar should be updated to the URL of that specific image, making it easily sharable.

h3. Actual Results
* The URL in the address bar remains as the URL of the page itself, which makes it hard to share the image in the macro.

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gallery macro does not update URL when images are clicked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [importing a page via Word import|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/import-content-into-confluence-cloud/#ImportContentintoConfluence-ImportWorddocuments], if the "Replace Page Name" option is selected, the uploaded document will properly replace the page, but the images will not load.

Although they are uploaded to the page (as they are visible in the *Attachments* part of the page), a thumbnail with the "Image failed to load" tip will be displayed:

!failed_demo.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Word document (.docx) and upload images to its body (I.E. PNG, JPEG)
 # In Confluence, create and publish a page.
 # On the published page, tap the ellipsis button at the top-right > *Advanced details* > *Import Word document*
 # Upload the file and tap *Import* once it is done.
 # On the *Where to import* part, select the *Replace* "Page name" option. The other options can use the default values.
 # Tap *Import*. Once it is over, access the page.

h3. Expected Results

The images should load as they are in the Word document.
h3. Actual Results

The image(s) does not load. Instead, an icon is displayed:

!failed_demo.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

There are three workarounds for this bug:
 * When importing the Word document, select the *Import as a new page in the current space* option as it will create a new page with the images properly loading.
 * When editing a new page (that was not published before), under the sidebar to select the template, switch to the *Import* option, and select *Word document* (.docx):
!template_demo.png!
 * Manually upload the images to the locations where they should be displayed.
fields.summary: Replacing an existing page via Word import will not load images

fields.description:
Ability to disable emails notification when Copy/Move Pages between spaces.

Scenario:

Copy/Move pages from Space A to Space B when this Page has several Users set as Watches, or Tasks assigned, etc. All users receive an email notification again.

Basic Workaround:

Turn off the option to send email notifications and then turn it on when "_migration_" is completed.

Go to _Confluence Settings_ then click on _Further Configuration_ on left bar. In the main page you will see an option "_Email Notification_" enabled by default. Click on _Edit_ button, uncheck this option and click on _Save_. During the time this option is disabled, users will not receive notifications while copying pages among the spaces.
fields.summary: Ability to disable emails notification when Copy/Move between spaces

fields.description:
When number are displayed these values exceed 3 digits, there is a convention to use a separator in order to show the difference between thousands, millions, billions, etc. and to represent decimal digits.

Different languages have different languages to represent the decimals and thousands,million etc.The only way to control this is to change your language settings and have your language/region settings adjust this on your behalf. 

Examples:
||Language||appearance||
|English|5,432|
|French|5.432|

 

Despite changing the Number field format under the confluence setting, the *Chart macro* does not indetify them correctly and continues with the conventional Comma method.
fields.summary: Allow number to accept dots to separate thousands and comma to indicate decimals

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a link to a page with the copy API causes the link not to work after the linked page is created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the page by setting a link in the body
{code}
curl --request POST \
  --url '<site>/wiki/rest/api/content/406650881/copy' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json;charset=UTF-8' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
   "copyAttachments": true,
   "copyPermissions": false,
   "copyProperties": false,
   "copyLabels": true,
   "copyCustomContents": false,
   "destination": {
     "type": "parent_page",
     "value": "406781953"
   },
   "pageTitle": "TargetPage",
   "body": {
      "storage": {
       "representation": "storage",
       "value": "<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title=\"Linked page\"/></ac:link>"
     }
   }
}' \
--basic --user '<userEmail>:<token>'
{code}
 # Create the linked page (called "Linked page" in the example above). 

h3. Expected Results
The linked page is opened when clicking on the page content.

If the linked page has not been created yet, a draft page of the page is created and is opened when clicking on the page content.

h3. Actual Results
The linked page is not opened when clicking on the page content.
This is because the URL that the browser tries to open is in this form:
{{<site>null/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=~711071095&title=LinkedPage&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=406683652}}

Notice the {{null}} after the <site> in the URL and the {{wiki}} part is missing. The correct URL would be:
{{<site>/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=~711071095&title=LinkedPage&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=406683652}}

h3. Notes
The problem is present regardless of how the "Linked page" is created (e.g. creating the page from the user interface, the /rest/api/content/<source-page-id>/copy API or the /rest/api/content API will all result in the same problem).


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a link to a page with the copy API causes the link not to work after the linked page is created

fields.description:

The capabilities should include at least:
 * Panel title
 * Choice of icon or no icon
 * Border style and color
 * Background color

fields.summary: Ability to create a "Panel" with customizable colors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A small refactor on the LeagcyMacroRendereQuery which involved extraction of a function into another file and small refactor caused a hot because the AP.confluence.getMacroBody() returns empty string. This was the fix: [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-frontend/pull-requests/20011/overview]

 

PR that broke: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-frontend/pull-requests/19820/overview

 

This could have been caught if there was an integration test for connect macros testing the rendering. We need it to prevent any further hots related to getMacroBody()
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a confluence page
 # Add dynamic macro
 # Input 123
 # Edit macro
 # You should see 123

h3. Expected Results

The test should fail with above change
h3. Actual Results

No tests exist
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add integration test for connect macros to prevent hot-97146

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When browsing between pages using the page tree on the left (SPA behavior), the page header images may fail to load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a number of pages with uniquely uploaded header images (about 8 or 9 is typically sufficient)
 # Step 2 Rapidly switch between the pages using the page tree. 
 # Step 3 It is possible that you may get them all to load. If they all load, try refreshing and then swapping between pages rapidly again. The goal is to switch between pages before the image has time to load.
 # you know you have triggered the bug when at least one page, although more is possible, no longer reserves a space for the header image.
 # Note: once a page fails to load the header, it will continue to fail to load the header until the whole page is refreshed.

h3. Expected Results
The header image is always prompted to load

h3. Actual Results

Sometime the page will fail to load the image and become "stuck" in this state. You will need to then reload the page to make the header display.

h3. Workaround

If the image fails to load, try refreshing the page.
fields.summary: browsing between pages using the page tree can cause uploaded page header images to fail to load

fields.description:

!image-2021-10-27-08-55-01-588.png!

 

!image-2021-10-27-08-55-08-445.png!

 

!image-2021-10-27-08-55-13-114.png!
fields.summary: As a user, I't like to be able to see Parent name in JQL query NOT the parent key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the copy REST API to replace the content of an existing page causes the attachments not to be visible to Anonymous users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a source page with an attachment
# Create a space with "Anonymous access granted". This is the target space.
# Create a page in the target space. The content of this page will be overwritten at the next step
# Overwrite the content of the target page via the API with the content of the source page
{code:java}
curl --request POST \
  --url '<site>/wiki/rest/api/content/401833985/copy' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json;charset=UTF-8' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "copyAttachments": true,
  "copyPermissions": true,
  "copyProperties": true,
  "copyLabels": false,
  "copyCustomContents": true,
  "destination": {
    "type": "existing_page",
    "value": "402161665"
  }
}' \
--basic --user '<userEmail>:<token>'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The attachments are visible to every user, including the anonymous ones.

h3. Actual Results
The attachments are only visible to logged in users and not to the anonymous ones.

h3. Workaround
There are a few options that can be considered here:
- For each affected attachment, download it from the attachment page and create a new version by re-uploading the same attachment. Potentially this can be automated.
- Remove the ability to access the space as anonymous user (which is done via the "Anonymous access granted" setting)
fields.summary: Using the copy REST API to replace the content of an existing page causes the attachments not to be visible to Anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence Cloud currently does not track or restrict specific terms that an organization might want to avoid, such as curse words or culturally inappropriate language.

A few examples: "Whitelist/Blacklist", "Master/Slave", "Blackout", "Man Hours" etc.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a new Feature to better control the usage of specific terms and suggest alternatives:
 # Create a list of terms to be watched
 # Provide a field for alternative terms to be suggested (Eg.: "Whitelist" can be changed to "Allowlist" instead)
 # Automatically scan new content (create and update) for the listed terms (from Pages, Blog Posts, Questions, Calendar Events etc)
 # Add Inline comments on top of the listed terms providing alternatives (Eg.: highlight a new "Whitelist" entry and add an Inline comment mentioning "Please consider using 'Allowlist' instead")
 # Create a Job to scan existing content and search for the listed terms
 # Provide a structured report based on the scanned results with metadata (Eg.: term used, number of times it is used, content where the term appears, link to the content, etc.)
 # Create a banned terms list and avoid content to be saved if it contains any of those.

h3. Workaround

1. Create reports based on SQL queries to be ran against the Confluence database to find those terms and provide related content metadata, such as:
{code:sql}
select * from BODYCONTENT 
WHERE body LIKE '%Whitelist%';
{code}

The results can be joined to the CONTENT table by using the corresponding *contentid*s for better results (Title, Creator, Creation Date etc).

2. Utilize third-party Apps / Plugins such as [Datastorm Content Guard|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1224666/datastorm-content-guard?tab=overview&hosting=cloud] by Datastorm.
fields.summary: Better control for specific terms

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On our documentation [Insert the recently updated macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-recently-updated-macro/], it specifies that it should be possible to select multiple spaces, as long it is separated by a comma or a space.

The same message is displayed under the search box for the macro, but when you try to select a second space or separate it with a comma or space, it does not work and selects only a single space instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the Fabric editor
 # Insert the Recently Updated macro
 # On the search box, choose a space
 # Try to add a second space, using a comma or space and press Enter

h3. Expected Results

It should allow the user to select multiple spaces, using a comma or space.
h3. Actual Results

It only allows the user to choose a single space or upon hitting enter when we type the space names, it chooses @self instead.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Recently Updated macro won't allow multiple spaces in search box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Anonymous users aren't able to export a page to PDF. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Global Anonymous access on your test Instance.
# Make sure you have at least one Space with Anonymous Access allowed on the Space Permissions.
# Open a new incognito window on your browser.
# Access the URL for this Space.
# Access a page from this Space.
# Click on the three ellipses > *Export* > *Export to PDF*.

h3. Expected Results
The page should be exported.

h3. Actual Results
The export fails - below error is displayed:

{code}
We couldn't complete your export. java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Export page to PDF not working for Anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users have been reporting that Jira macros within a Confluence site are failing to load.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
# Add a Jira macro to it.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The macros should work consistently.

h3. Actual Results

The macros are unstable. Users are seeing the following message when accessing Confluence pages with Jira macros:

{code}
Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in JIRA.
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-26 at 11.49.56.png|thumbnail! 

(i) Sometimes, the issues will not load and will keep with a *Loading issues* message.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira issues macro fails to load intermittently

fields.description:
As a user, I can prefix the page header with an emoticon. This is a nice new feature that should definitely be expanded. 
I would also like to be able to display the pages in the sidebar sorted by emoticons. 
Super helpful would also be a macro that allows me to display pages filtered to specific emoticons. Similar to the task report or the decision report.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently, there isn’t a way to turn off page analytics within Confluence Standard. Due to data protection concerns, customers are asking for the ability to *disable page Analytics* for Confluence Standard.
h2. Suggestion

Have a global configuration where you can deactivate page Analytics for your Confluence instance.
fields.summary: Disable Page Analytics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Apps using Static Content Macro display emojis as star

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install any app that uses Static Content Macro like Numbered Headings, MultipleExcerpts, or MultiExcerptMacro, etc.
 # Use these apps and put emojis on it
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The emojis should render as they are

h3. Actual Results

The emojis render as a blue star

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Apps using Static Content Macro display emojis as star

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Currently Confluence Cloud is only fully compatible with QWERTY keyboards.
* Other keyboard layouts work, but certain keyboard shortcuts, specifically those that use "Alt" combinations do not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* In a Confluence page in edit, any shortcuts that uses "Alt" will not work on a QWERTZ keyboard as the rest of the keys are disabled when "Alt" is hit.
**   !CTRL+ATL_qwertz.png|thumbnail! 
* This is unlike the QWERTY keyboard.
**  !CTRL+ATL_qwerty.png|thumbnail! 
* As a result of this, the following shortcuts are unusable.
**  !Cloud_shortcuts.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
* Option to have other shortcut options like the one in Confluence Server, or have the shortcut options modifiable.
**  !Server_shortcuts.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support QWERTZ keyboards in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud allows you to add [the Gallery macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-gallery-macro/] to display a gallery of images that meet the macro search criteria. Even though the documentation states that this macro was removed from the *current editor*, it is actually still available. However, the images on the macro results aren't properly clickable.

(on) This bug only affects the *current editor* - it doesn't affect the *Legacy editor*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the new editor.
 # Upload images to this page.
 # Edit the page again, and place the *Gallery* macro on this page.
 # Publish the page. 
 # Note that the image thumbnails will be clickable. Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results

After refreshing the page, the images should still be clickable.
h3. Actual Results

After refreshing the page, the images are no *longer clickable*.

h3. Workaround
In the page with the Gallery macro, add the "Attachments" macro, anywhere on the page (preferably at the bottom of the page to avoid interrupting any content viewing).
fields.summary: The Images from the Gallery macro are not clickable

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, administrators can view [a list of restricted pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions/#AddorRemovePageRestrictions-Viewallrestrictedpagesinaspace] by accessing each space individually, allowing them to quickly remove them.

h3.Suggestion

When migrating between instances, for operations like custom exports or scenarios where the users with access to the restricted pages are no longer in the company, restricted pages will not be visible until the restrictions are manually removed.

To simplify the process and have all the pages centralized in a single part, similar to how the [Space permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/what-are-space-permissions/] function work in the administration, this is a suggestion to have an option displaying all the restricted pages and the space where they belong to.
fields.summary: Ability to list all restricted pages in Confluence

This is causing users that have booked the first link to face 404 Page not Found
fields.summary: Space Directory link does not work

fields.description:
*Description*

In the current Premium edition of Confluence, the analytics related to page views are available. However it is not currently capturing the page edit information.

*Suggestion*

Provide provision in anaytics so that the content edit information is also captured. The user should be able to take reports of edits across pages in a space(or spaces) along with the editor's information.
fields.summary: Provision to show Page edit reports in Confluence Analytics.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user [added as a guest|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/] has the site access revoked by an administrator (not removing the user from the userbase), a daily email will still be triggered for administrators, stating that the user does not have access to any spaces.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add a user a guest (including in a guest group or toggling the *Guest* access on).
 * As a site admin, access the user profile on the user management of the instance.
 * On the user profile toggle the *Site access* option off.
 * Wait around 24 hours for the email to be triggered.

h3. Expected Results

No emails should be sent as the user has the access revoked.
h3. Actual Results

A daily email is sent, even though the user no longer has site access:
{quote}*Some guests on your site don't have access to any spaces*

The following guests don't have any space access to your Confluence site:

GUEST USER (Unlicensed)

Without access to at least one space, guests won't be able to collaborate.
{quote}
h3. Workaround
 * Reactivate the site access for the user (toggle the *Site access* option on) and then, toggle the *Guest* option off. This should remove the user from the guest group.
 * Delete/remove the user from the site by going to the user's profile > ellipsis button at the top-right > *Remove user*).
fields.summary: When a guest has site access revoked, emails about the guest not having space access will still be triggered

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When a user is [added as a guest|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/], but does not have access to any spaces in Confluence, a daily email will be triggered for administrators:

{quote}
*Some guests on your site don't have access to any spaces*

The following guests don't have any space access to your Confluence site:

GUEST USER

Without access to at least one space, guests won't be able to collaborate.
{quote}

h3.Suggestion

While this is a very useful feature, having this email daily could be a bit disruptive for scenarios where the user is added as a guest but does not have space access until they are ready.

This is a suggestion to allow the frequency of emails for guests without space access to be manually configured by admins. For example:

* Change from daily to weekly or monthly
* Disable these emails
fields.summary: Customize email frequency for guests without space access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upon doing a [space export to HTML|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml/#Export-a-space], if the attachments uploaded to the page(s) are deleted, they will be displayed on the list of attachments within the HTML file for the page(s) in question.

This can cause confusion since the number of attachments on a page will be different from what is included in the HTML file.
h3. Suggestion

While purging the attachments from the trash will no longer include them in the exported HTML, this is a suggestion to remove the deleted attachments from HTML exports, matching the number provided in the *Attachments* session of the page.
fields.summary: Remove deleted attachments from HTML exports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the *Decision report macro* to the page, we cannot see any results (decisions) if we select the current page in the 'With parent' filter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your Confluence instance
 # *Create* a new page
 # Add *decisions* to it
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-22 at 11.10.36.png|width=209,height=159!
 # Add the *decisions report macro* to the same page
 # *Edit* the *decisions report macro* and add the 'With parent' filter and select the current page

h3. Expected Results
 * The decisions from the current page should show up on the decisions report macro. 

h3. Actual Results
 * Instead of showing up the decisions from the current page, it shows {{No decisions found}}

!Screen Shot 2021-10-22 at 11.10.17.png|width=304,height=68!
h3. Workaround

The current workaround for this behavior is creating a new page and then set this new page to be the parent page of the page where you added the decisions.

!Screen Shot 2021-10-22 at 11.23.49.png|width=133,height=71!

Then, you can add the *decisions report macro* to the page that has decisions and *Edit* the *decisions report macro* to add the 'With parent' filter and select the page which you recently created and set up as the parent page of the page where you added the decisions.

!Screen Shot 2021-10-22 at 11.10.28.png|width=239,height=208!
fields.summary: Decision report macro displays 'No decisions found' when 'With parent' filter is the current page itself

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Drag and drop of files in Confluence is not working in view mode with the new editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page in view mode with the new editor.
 # Drag the file directly onto the page.

h3. Expected Results

The file should be attached to the page.

h3. Actual Results

The file is opened in a new browser tab.

h3. Workaround

Open 'More Actions' >> Attachments  and drag and drop the file to the 'Drop files here to attach them'
fields.summary: Drag and Drop of files in the view mode opens them in a new tab on new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Can't browse to another page of Labelled content search results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to "https://<SITE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/labels/listlabels-alphaview.action"
# Then click on any mentioned label that is being labeled on 20-30 pages (basically with high usage)
# Click on mentioned page numbers. The index number in the URL will change but the page list will remain as it's on page 1

h3. Expected Results
The results' list must change on clicking respective page numbers

h3. Actual Results
The results' list remain same on clicking different page numbers
 !image-2021-10-22-14-13-58-077.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-10-22-14-15-30-440.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Click on 'Next' instead of page numbers
fields.summary: Can't browse to another page of Labelled content search results

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

The Confluence Server → Cloud space import fails as the file contains a user that has an email address that our system flags as invalid.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Have a user in the file which Cloud importer regards as invalid. 

h3. Expected Results

There should be a validation of the space import for invalid emails.

h3. Actual Results.
The validation ignores these invalid users and the import is triggered. 
However, the import then errors out due to these invalid users. 

h3. Details
Error in the splunk logs.
{code}com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.BadRequestException: {"errorType":"InvalidSchema","message":"Invalid email address"}{code}

h3. Workaround
Remove / Fix the invalid users in the XML files and retrigger the import. 

h3. *Note*

This is especially bad for Confluence Space import as the message of the failure is too generic "Transaction rolled back because it is marked as rollback only." Not giving any indication this has failed due to invalid emails in the entities file.
fields.summary: Users with invalid emails aren't detected during the validation phase.

fields.description:
Summary

Space imports are failing with:

 *"Cannot start import, looks like another one is already running. Please try again in a few minutes"*
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export an individual space .xml export
 # Import the space in a new cloud site

h3. Expected Results

Space imports should be completed as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Space imports are failing with error:

 *"Cannot start import, looks like another one is already running. Please try again in a few minutes"*

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
 message: Attempt to re-run a Space Import while lock is still held by other thread. 
{noformat}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cloud space imports error |  Cannot start import, looks like another one is already running. Please try again in a few minutes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have hardcoded links to attachments and you migrate over to the Cloud those links will be broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert an attachment on a page.
# On the sidebar of the page, click on the three-dotted button select "Attachments" from the menu.
# Copy the link, it should be something like this for Cloud https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/pageid/attachment_name?api=v2
# Paste on another page

h3. Expected Results

Links would be updated to the new URL and the page id's as well.

h3. Actual Results

The links will be broken still pointing to the old instance.

h3. Workaround

We don't have a fix for these links yet.

*Note:* This behavior currently affects any kind of Confluence migrations, site import, space import, and Cloud Migration Assistant. Since the page id's change, it's very difficult to map those to the new pages.
fields.summary: Links to attachments are broken after a migration

fields.description:

fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence import is breaking due to existing users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to migrate a space from Server to Cloud, the users within the space are showing as "Former user"

h3. Environment
* Server to Cloud migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space on Confluence Server
# Mention some users on a page (whether the user exists on Confluence Cloud)
# Import the space into Confluence Cloud using Migration Assistant

h3. Expected Results
* Users are imported but have no product access
* Users are mapped with an account on Confluence Cloud
 !image-2019-07-19-15-34-33-006.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Users are not mapped with the accounts

h3. Notes
* (!) Able to replicate with:
** An older version of Migration Assistant
** Latest version of Migration Assistant without user import
** Latest version of Migration Assistant with user import
** Manual import (without Migration Assistant)
* (/) Cloud to Cloud space import is working fine.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Server To Cloud: User Mappings are broken

fields.summary: Space Import to Confluence Cloud fails if user email is invalid and cannot be invited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you mentioned a Jira issue on a Confluence page, a mention of this page will be displayed in the Jira issue. It is also possible to link a page from a Jira issue, and this kind of link is also broken after deleting reimporting the space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete a space that is mentioned or linked in Jira issues
 # Re-import the same space

h3. Expected Results
Page links and mentions will be restored/displayed after the import.

h3. Actual Results
Pages that were previously mentioned in Confluence don't have any mentions in the Jira issue and pages that were linked directly in the issue have the message *We couldn't load this page. - Open in Confluence*, if you click to open in Confluence you will be directed to the previous page id and receive a "Page not found" error.

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Mentioned pages in Jira issues are broken after reimporting spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When running the Jira Macro repair after a Confluence space import, there is an error "cannot deserialize from Object value".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import spaces in Cloud
# Run the Jira macro repair

*This is not happening for all runs, it's an intermittent issue.

h3. Expected Results

The Jira macro repair runs without an issue

h3. Actual Results

Error message:

 !2.PNG|thumbnail! 

{noformat}
"Error when doing doFixingCannot construct instance of `com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.content.id.ContentId` (although at least one Creator exists): cannot deserialize from Object value (no delegate- or property-based Creator)
 at [Source: (String)""{""appLinkMappingList"":[{""newAppLink"":{""server"":""System JIRA"",""serverId"":""
....
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Try it again after a few hours, if it persists, please, [contact support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Deserialization error when running Jira macro repair

fields.description:
*Ability to set new Confluence Pages as Private only*.

There is an ability to add a new group in Global/Space permissions, but not possible to add it without checking at least one permissions like View or Edit. If you add a new group without any features checked, group is not added and will not work as Private.

Further details here: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PCS-61455]
fields.summary: Ability to set new Confluence Pages as Private only

fields.description:
h3. Issue
When importing a .zip file ( back up file) without read permission to Jira or Confluence Cloud site, the file is being processed forever. Without throwing any error message.

h3. Steps to replicate
* Take a file ( any site backup)
* Import it to Jira cloud site.
* The file import keeps running at 0%
* There is no progress at all.
* This is definitely an expected behavior. But would be great if we implement the feature to detect such files and throw an error.

Same applies to Confluence site import/Space import

 !Screenshot 2020-05-29 at 9.00.18 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error message should be thrown when Importing a file without Read permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When doing a space import capture from another Cloud instance, it may happen that for some reason the import will fail.

Depending on the actual problem the error message can be quite vague, like this:

{quote}
The following error(s) occurred:
There was an error during import. Please see our guide to raising a bug report.
{quote}

That doesn't help the person doing the import and often users need to rely on support to figure the problem through the backend logs.

h3. Expected Results

Ideally, the import would work but a more detailed message can help understand the problem and allow users to self-serve on a workaround.

h3. Actual Results

The space import fails with a generic error message:

{quote}
The following error(s) occurred:
There was an error during import. Please see our guide to raising a bug report.
{quote}

Note: Usually these generic types of errors may occur due to the zip file of the exported space having additional folders in it, especially when the entities.xml and exportDescriptor.properties not being in the root of the zip file.

See the example below for the proper format of the space export file:

{noformat}
Confluence-space-export.zip
├── exportDescriptor.properties
├── entities.xml
├── attachments
│   ├── 334556
│   └── 334557
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Make sure the file has the proper format and retry the import.
fields.summary: Improve space import error message

fields.description: Automate and show to the admin a message to run "Jira Macro Repair" when required.
fields.summary: Automate Jira Macro Repair process post-migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a myriad of macros that can be used in the Confluence Server/DC that are not compatible with the Cloud environment.

When you migrate a space that contains pages with macros that are not compatible with Cloud the macro breaks and start showing a warning box with "unknown macro":

An example:

!a7efabfb-dc73-48ae-b686-d1ee0086fb28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The incompatible macros code would be stripped during import, leaving the text part inside the macro intact.

h3. Actual Results

A warning box is shown saying the macro is unknown.

h3. Workaround

You can remove the macros on the server prior to migrating to the Cloud.
fields.summary: Improve how we handle incompatible macros coming from server
